answers.answer: I'm sure you are concerned but try to relax and be patient because there is nothing going to happen until long after you get all your test results.  Many of us have gone thru the "panic" stage, not knowing then knowing.  Also, many have had it for over 20 years.What ever the results are good luck and try not to worry until you have something to worry about.

Although hepc is often indicated by high liver enzymes it could be a number of other things so don't sweat it until you get the results back. And even don't sweat it then - stressing isn't going to help anything at all!

question: I have been having alot going on with my body . I go to the doctor to get checked for diabetes and they call me and tell me my ALT and AST are very high. My ALT was 146 my AST was 121 I am very concerned. I have to get a stomach ultrasound done next week and a hepatitis lab done today/ I am concerned!!!
title: Concerned
